document.docAuthor: Da Silva Sovano, Rafael S. & Cadena-Castañeda, Oscar J.
document.docTitle: Microcentrum xavieri Sovano & Cadena-Castaneda, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of Microcentrum Scudder, 1862 (Orthoptera: Tettigonioidea: Phaneropteridae) from Amazon rainforest

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of Microcentrum Scudder, 1862 (Orthoptera: Tettigonioidea: Phaneropteridae) from Amazon rainforest

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype .
♂ Brasil , Amazonas, Manaus, ZF- 2 Km- 14 , Torre 35 mts altura (
02° 35 ' 21 "s
/
60 °06' 35 "w
)
13- 16 .viii. 2004
, J.A.Rafael; F.F.Xavier F°; A.R.Ururahy; A.Silva F°, & S.Trovisco, Lençol: Luz Mista e BLB. ( INPA ).

Description. Color: Light-green (
Fig. 3
A). Head: Broad fastigium (one half the length of the pedicel antennal), contiguous to the forehead (
Fig. 3
B). Globular compound eyes. Central ocellus conspicuous, lighter colored when compared to remainder of the body. Thorax: Pronotum Smooth, lateral lobes longer than broad, lighter in color when compared to remainder of the body (
Fig. 3
C). Tegmen lanceolate with a conspicuous reticulate venation as a mined leaf, anterior margin with yellow punctuations along its proximal half, black pigmented stridulatory field (
Fig. 3
D). Legs: hind femur with the proximal portion lighter in color compared to remainder of the body. Abdomen : tenth tergite unmodified, epiproct projected, triangular, not acuminate. Forcepslike cerci, without ramifications, armed with a tooth at apex (
Fig. 3
E). Subgenital plate longer than broad, anterior portion deeply emarginated with slender stylus (
Fig. 3
F).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Microcentrum xavieri , Sovano, Cadena-Casteñada
n. sp. Photo: Diego Mendes.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments . Some specimens may display a slight variation in the pattern of tegmen spots (
Fig. 3
G). This variation has so far been observed only in individuals collected at high altitudes (Roraima State proximities). Remaining characteristics of these specimens agree exactly like those of the holotype .

Females. Coloration of the specimens and body structure according to the holotype description. Subgenital plate rectangular, proximal margin emarginated, V-shaped; distal margin slightly depressed in the median portion (
Fig. 4
A). Ovipositor short (mean 6 : 13 mm ), abruptly curved upwards, distal portion serrate from the inner margin to its apex, with the external margin smooth (
Fig. 4
B).
Etymology. The specific epithet is in honor and acknowledgment to the biologist Francisco Felipe Xavier Filho (Chiquinho), friend and collector of this species.
Distribution. Known for the State of Amazonas, Brazil , for Colombia , and for localities at the Brazil- Colombia boundary.

Examinated material. Paratypes :
2 ♀ Brasil , Amazonas, Presidente Figueiredo, Am 240 —Km- 24 (Est. Balbina) (

/
59 ° 49 ' 40 "w

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Microcentrum xavieri , Sovano, Cadena-Casteñada
n. sp. A) Female, lateral view; B) Pronotal disc, dorsal view; C) Subgenital plate, ventral view; D) Ovipositor, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
As from the occurrence localities of the Amazonian species of
Microcentrum
(
Table 1
), a distribution map was plotted (
Fig. 5
), according to the areas of endemism established to Amazon.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE1. Amazonian
Microcentrum
according to occurrence localities.
